user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_rq_nc:
```c
static enum MHD_GetRqNCResult
get_rq_nc (const struct MHD_RqDAuth *params,
           uint32_t *nc)
{
  const struct MHD_RqDAuthParam *const nc_param =
    &params->nc;
  char unq[16];
  const char *val;
  size_t val_len;
  size_t res;
  uint64_t nc_val;

  if (NULL == nc_param->value.str)
    return MHD_GET_RQ_NC_NONE;

  if (0 == nc_param->value.len)
    return MHD_GET_RQ_NC_BROKEN;

  if (! nc_param->quoted)
  {
    val = nc_param->value.str;
    val_len = nc_param->value.len;
  }
  else
  {
    /* Actually no backslashes must be used in 'nc' */
    if (sizeof(unq) < params->nc.value.len)
      return MHD_GET_RQ_NC_TOO_LONG;
    val_len = MHD_str_unquote (nc_param->value.str, nc_param->value.len, unq);
    if (0 == val_len)
      return MHD_GET_RQ_NC_BROKEN;
    val = unq;
  }

  res = MHD_strx_to_uint64_n_ (val, val_len, &nc_val);
  if (0 == res)
  {
    const char f = val[0];
    if ( (('9' >= f) && ('0' <= f)) ||
         (('F' >= f) && ('A' <= f)) ||
         (('a' <= f) && ('f' >= f)) )
      return MHD_GET_RQ_NC_TOO_LARGE;
    else
      return MHD_GET_RQ_NC_BROKEN;
  }
  if (val_len != res)
    return MHD_GET_RQ_NC_BROKEN;
  if (UINT32_MAX < nc_val)
    return MHD_GET_RQ_NC_TOO_LARGE;
  *nc = (uint32_t) nc_val;
  return MHD_GET_RQ_NC_VALID;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (sizeof(unq) < params->nc.value.len)
      return MHD_GET_RQ_NC_TOO_LONG;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Violation: if params->nc.value.len equals sizeof(unq) (16) the check (sizeof(unq) < params->nc.value.len) passes and MHD_str_unquote is called with unq as destination. If MHD_str_unquote writes a terminating NUL or otherwise writes value.len+1 bytes or uses a string.h routine that copies the source length plus a terminator (e.g. strcpy/memcpy of len+1), this will write beyond the unq buffer and thus violate Rule 21.17. The check should ensure room for any required terminator (e.g. use <=) or the unquote function should receive the destination size to avoid out‑of‑bounds accesses.
